metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12405 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When browsing a malicious page, a race condition in our SharedWorkerService could occur and lead to a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 68.9.0, Firefox < 77, and Firefox ESR < 68.9.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12405` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 77.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 77.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 77.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '77.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
